website_summaries.verdict: Climbing enthusiasts looking for a shoe in which they can toe hook magnificently might find one in the Butora Narsha. Those in need of a superbly comfortable and sticky shoe—one that also provides fantastic edging prowess—might find one in this product as well.The Butora rock shoe in question, however, might disappoint those who prefer shoes that offer the greatest sensitivity. Nonetheless, the Narsha is yet another remarkable Butora piece whose collection of traits gives confidence on steep ascents.
pros: The Butora Narsha toe hooks like a champ, according to almost everyone who has tested it
Many of those who have bought the shoe adore its incredible edging performance
Its ability to stick to a variety of surfaces is exemplary, say several wearers who have tried it
A decent number of those who have used the Butora Narsha (wide or narrow) consider it an impressively comfortable footgear
This amazing rock climbing shoe can heel hook exceptionally well, say a handful of owners who have used it many times
The Butora Narsha’s durability is outstanding, according to a couple of users who have put it through the wringer
cons: This climb-centric shoe from Butora lacks sensitivity, an expert who has tested it says
Less than a handful of those who have purchased the Narsha finds it a real challenge to break in

customer_reviews.title: with great effort pulling the heal tabs
customer_reviews.text: I bought two pairs, one was my foot size, 9. I have wide feet, so I figured I try my regular wide shoes size. I was wrong. I next bought the 11.5, ignoring the recendation to size up one. I sized up two. I can manage my foot inside this time, with great effort pulling the heal tabs. My foot was crunched as heck. Very uncomfortable. Returning the shoes. I knocked off stars for the unhelpful sizing. The shoes are pretty rigid and will need breaking in.
customer_reviews.author: Bluyt

customer_reviews.title: Not for bouldering.
customer_reviews.text: Oh man this is definitely the worst bouldering show ever made. The rubber is slick and not grippy. I liked how stiff the shoe is like my solutions but that's where the similarities end. I have tried over 40 shoes probably and this is by far the worst. I got these for 90 bucks but I feel like I would have been disappointed even if they were free. These just sit in my closet taking up space.
customer_reviews.author: oh sung shin

customer_reviews.title: wanted to love em
customer_reviews.text: My other style of Butora shoes are my favorite climbing shoes ever, so I thought I would give these a try. I tried several sizes and the fit just never worked for me. These shoes are also pretty heavy considering how much rubber is used.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Hartman

customer_reviews.title: Aggressive, quality, beautiful, hard to break in.
customer_reviews.text: Take much longer to break in compared to other brands of shoes, but the Butora Narshas are some quality aggressive shoes and look clean as hell. The design on the top of the toe area does seem to give me some impressive toe hook grip. However I can't put enough strain on the aggressive part of this review. Great shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Jon LeForge

customer_reviews.title: Size up, but amazing
customer_reviews.text: This is truly an innovation in climbing shoes technology. It is the best edging shoe that I have ever worn hands down and I will continue to use this shoe for the foreseeable future unless someone can outperform this wonderful shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Narrow fit
customer_reviews.text: Very difficult to get on - you need a narrow foot.
customer_reviews.author: Carl P Gabbard

customer_reviews.title: Not the best for bouldering
customer_reviews.text: This are NOT for SLIM feet. Very hard at the beginning as they should be. Not the best for bouldering.
customer_reviews.author: Lorenzo

customer_reviews.title: Relief for wide feet
customer_reviews.text: Great stiff shoe for vertical climbing (top rope/lead). I have street size 13 feet and these size 13 fit perfectly snug despite the painful breaking in period. For bouldering I would recommend a softer shoe
customer_reviews.author: Denis K.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Nothing bad to note. The toe hook grip is really good. Took some wearing in though.
customer_reviews.author: greedsever

customer_reviews.title: Order up 2 whole sizes!!!
customer_reviews.text: They’re SOOO small!!! The shoe is almost 2 sizes smaller than it should be
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Detweiler

customer_reviews.title: Good edging. Rigid construction. Snug heel.
customer_reviews.text: Took me two years to find a shoe I liked as much as the old orange Scarpa Vapors after they remodeled them into that crappy ass greed version. It's definitely a harder shoe but I feel like I get a feel for any shoe fairly quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Tranzow

customer_reviews.title: Stiff is the new black
customer_reviews.text: Delivered super fast, and I love them. Sized them up 1.5 sizes from my la sportivas. The edge is grippy, but the shiny rubber on the bottom isn't. I recommend scuffing that up with something before you slip off the jugs on your V0 warmup.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: And I got the narrow one that fits like a glove
customer_reviews.text: I had to get a bigger size than my endeavor, And I got the narrow one that fits like a glove. Overtime it did got better and less painful. These shoes are very good for overhangs, toe hookings ... bathanging is the most fun for these shoes. I tried to do with other shoes and they are painful to do but with these shoes, they are phenomenal. The con side for these shoes is being stiff and not good for smearing or on tiny slopy holds, I would slip, on the volumes as well. So mainly for bouldering, not for vertical climbs
customer_reviews.author: May Siegrist

customer_reviews.title: Narsha is my favorite all around climbing shoe.
customer_reviews.text: These are for wide feet. I’ve climbed with these shoes since they first came out and they are my favorite for Sport Climbing. I also wear the Arcos size 10.5, so with the Narsha 11 is the perfect size up for me. Arcos are super snug on my feet but the Narsha I can wear all day long. Everyone has a favorite brand and with the 4 years climbing I’ve settled with the Butora Brand.
customer_reviews.author: D. Dural

customer_reviews.title: Great edging on steeper rock
customer_reviews.text: Great edging on steeper rock, flawless heel and toe hooking with no dead space in the heel cup. I find them very comfortable for a performance shoe. They're also exceptionally well built and are showing very little wear after about 20-30 days of outdoor use.
customer_reviews.author: rocks are people too

customer_reviews.title: Size up
customer_reviews.text: Size 1 Street shoe up. I’m a size 7 and got a size 7 it’s been a month(3-6times/wk) and my feet are in pain after climbing. Otherwise, they work real well. Sticky solid sole, tight fit gets you close to the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!! And looks awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Dope shoe, great for any grade bouldering. Went with the same size at my street shoe. Painful to wear even after a couple months but the great functionality is far worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent gabb

customer_reviews.title: They don’t stretch don’t downsize
customer_reviews.text: Possibly the greatest shoe ever made for small edge climbing
customer_reviews.author: Nick

product_meta.title: Butora Narsha Climbing Shoes Orange/Black 2019 Sport Shoes
product_meta.description: They represent the latest in innovation and technology for climbing shoes. The perfect combination of precision, performance and comfort. Thanks to the Neo Fit System design, the heel fits perfectly and keeps the shoe from sliding off on heel hooks. In addition to the Velcro fastener, it has an extra pull inside to adjust better the instep. With its scaly instep, it will become your best ally to edge. This model is for wide feet. Product specific size information: Normal cut Fit: Normal Weight Weight single shoe: 64 g Climbing Shoes Category: performance Applications: Indoor climbing Climbing Shoe Material Sole: Neo Fuse Outer material: Microfibre Climbing Shoe Features Closure: Slipper With Toepatch With adjustable straps Number of straps: 2 Heel construction: Full rubberised Tongue: One-sided on the shaft Sole Design type: Partially divided Preload: strongly Downturn: weak Type bands: Strongly asymmetric Sole stiffness: strongly Cut Fit foot width: wide Tip of the shoe: pointed
feature_bullets: Unique heel and rand System stretching four ways for a fit you can count on - no more heel slippage!
Injection molded sole with formed arch support and 3D molded heel cup
Internal NFS strap that allows for all Day comfort or extreme precision - customize by tightening the strap
Beautifully designed toe cover made for toe hooking
